sections.title: MBBS Admission in Karnataka 2025-26, Colleges Seat Matrix, Fee Structure, Application process, cut-off and Counselling

content.content: Karnataka is a bustling center of industry, innovation, and education, celebrated for its vibrant culture, storied past, and significant economic contributions to India. Its capital.

Renowned as a premier destination for medical education in India, Karnataka offers a plethora of undergraduate and postgraduate medical programs, drawing students from all corners of the nation. Admission to MBBS programs in Karnataka is conducted through the NEET exam, with successful candidates participating in state counseling for enrollment.
The MBBS curriculum in Karnataka spans 5.5 years, comprising 4.5 years of academic study and 1 year of compulsory internship, providing students with comprehensive training and practical experience.

In Karnataka aspiring MBBS students have a variety of options available for admission. The state boasts both government and private medical colleges and universities. Typically, securing admission into government medical colleges is more competitive than private ones, resulting in higher cut-off marks for government institutions.

The total number of MBBS seats in Karnataka can vary each year due to factors such as government policies, changes in infrastructure, and accreditation of new medical colleges. For MBBS Admission Karnataka 2025 total 9745 seats are available in Government and private Medical Colleges in Karnataka. The state has 0 AIIMS College and 20 Government and 31 Private Medical Colleges.

In the following sections, we will delve into the specifics of MBBS admission for the academic year 2025-26 in Karnataka including details on college seat matrix, fee structure, application process, cut-off marks, and counseling procedures. For personalized assistance with MBBS admission in India or abroad, feel free to reach out to our dedicated admission counseling team at MBBS APP.

content.content: The NEET cutoff is determined based on various factors such as the number of applicants, the difficulty level of the exam, and the availability of seats in medical and dental colleges. It varies for different categories like General, OBC, SC, ST, and others. Each state and college may also have its own cutoff scores. Generally, higher cutoffs are seen in prestigious colleges and for popular courses. It’s crucial for aspiring medical students to keep track of cutoff trends and prepare accordingly

content.list:
• The application form must be filled out entirely online. Only online application fees are accepted from students.
  • In order to register for the Karnataka MBBS 2025- 26 application form, applicants must input their personal, academic, NEET score, and other information. The authority will announce the merit ranking and adhere to the procedure of document verification, choice-filling, and place-allocation.
  • The Karnataka MBBS Admission Application Form is now available, and candidates can submit their applications till the deadline.
  • Candidates must bring a hard copy of their admissions application along with all Original Documents when they report to the designated medical or dental college; otherwise, their application will be rejected/disqualified without further communication.

content.table:
EventDates
Fresh Registration for 2nd RoundTo be Announced
Last date for registration/ Submit the application formTo be Announced
Provisional Merit ListTo be Announced
Join the Allotted College After Paying FeesTo be Announced
College Provide the Approval List of CandidatesTo be Announced

content.list:
• Only applicants who meet the eligibility criteria will be able to access the Karnataka MBBS / BDS 2025- 26 admission. Check out the Karnataka MBBS eligibility criteria detailed below.
  • Nationality: Indian citizens are eligible for admission to the Karnataka NEET 2025. NRI applicants can apply for NRI quota places.
  • Qualification: Candidates must have passed the 2nd PUC / Class 12 / or an equivalent exam with a minimum score of 50%. The minimum score required for candidates in the reserved category is 40%.
  • Subjects studied: Students must have studied Physics, Chemistry, Biology and English as compulsory subjects.
  • Domicile: Students must belong to Karnataka domicile to apply for admission to the Karnataka MBBS 2025- 26. Students outside of Karnataka can apply for open and other quota places in private colleges. Karnataka domicile students can apply for admission to the Karnataka MBBS 2025- 26 in government seats based on the following criteria.
  • Applicants who have studied in Karnataka for a minimum period of seven years at an institution recognized by the government or the government are admitted.
  • Candidates who have passed 11th and 12th places from Karnataka and whose parents have studied in Karnataka for seven years are eligible.
  • Applicants and both parents who are native speakers of Kannada, Tulu or Kodava are eligible. Such candidates must present themselves in the Kannada language test.
  • Defense son / daughter staff that passed 11th and 12th grade from Karnataka is eligible.

• Karnataka MBBS application form 2025- 26
  • Karnataka MBBS application fee payment receipt
  • 2 passport size photographs of the candidate
  • NEET 2023 admit card
  • NEET-UG score card
  • SSLC / class 10 mark sheet
  • 2nd PUC / class 12 mark sheet
  • Candidate’s study certificate
  • Caste / caste income certificate
  • Domicile certificate
  • Rural study certificate for 10 years of study (for rural quota)
  • Kannada medium study certificate for 10 years of study (for Kannada medium quota)
  • Parent’s study/hometown/ domicile / employment / cumulative record / mark sheet certificates

content.content: The state Government of Karnataka has decided to introduce 27% OBC-NCL, 15% SC, 10% EWS, 7.5% ST and 5% PwD Candidate MBBS and BDS seats with effect from 2025 academic sessions.
As you know about MBBS App is well known Career Guidance and Educational Consultant Rajasthan India, Offers three valuable tools for medical students in India. Those who have giving NEET exam.
MBBS App, a reputable educational consultancy based in Rajasthan, India, offers three essential tools tailored for students who have appeared for the NEET exam in India.

NEET 2024 College Predictor: This tool assists aspiring medical students by providing insights into potential medical colleges based on their NEET scores. With the competition for seats in medical institutions growing fiercer, this tool helps students find suitable colleges aligned with their performance.

NEET 2024 Rank Predictor: The rank predictor tool helps aspiring medical students estimate their potential rank based on their NEET performance. In the competitive landscape of medical admissions, this tool offers candidates a realistic projection of their standing among their peers.
Q. Why is fee structure for self-financing medical colleges Karnataka?
Ans. The fee structure for self-financing medical colleges depends the college’s popularity.
Q. What will be the fee for a deemed medical college in Karnataka seat?
Ans. The fee for counselling in Karnataka Deemed Medical College will differ for particular colleges, to check the complete Karnataka Deemed Medical College Fees Structure read above articles.
Q. What are the Fee of NRI MBBS seats in medical colleges in Karnataka?
Ans. Fee of NRI MBBS seats in Medical Colleges in Karnataka is different for every medical college.
